## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
View(RTLedu::strava)
```

You can add options to executable code like this 

```{r}
data1 <- RTLedu::strava
data1

cleaned_data <- data1 %>% 
  select(Date, Activity.Type, Runner, Avg.HR, Max.HR, Aerobic.TE, Avg.Pace, Best.Pace, Distance, Time, Calories,
    Avg.Power, Max.Power, Training.Stress.Score.,
    Avg.Run.Cadence, Max.Run.Cadence, Avg.Stride.Length, Avg.Vertical.Ratio,
    Avg.Vertical.Oscillation, Avg.Ground.Contact.Time,
    Total.Ascent, Total.Descent, Moving.Time, Elapsed.Time,
    Avg.Resp, Max.Resp, Min.Resp)

cleaned_data

cleaner_data <- cleaned_data %>% 
  select(where(~ all(!is.na(.) & . != 0))) %>% 
  select(-Avg.Resp, -Max.Resp, -Min.Resp)

cleaner_data
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
